result.markdown:
--- title: "0 to portfolio website" date: "2025-02-10" author: isabel zimmerman + valentina colorado format: html --- - A [GitHub](https://github.com/) or [Quarto Pages]() account - The [Positron IDE](https://positron.posit.co/download.html) ## What is Quarto? - __literate programming__: Create reports, blogs, and presentations with code and text. - __many formats__: Export to PDF, HTML, Word, Powerpoint, and more. ## Create new folder from template - Creating a new folder, or directory, to organize our files - Self-contained ![](./images/step1.png) ## Choose empty project - We can add Python or R code later, let's just start with something basic ![](images/step2.png) ## Name your folder - If you have a GitHub username, make this folder named `GITHUB-USERNAME.github.io` ![](images/step3.png) ## View new folder ![](images/step4.png) ## Click on "Search bar at the top" - Go to `Show and Run Commands` ![](images/step5.png) ## Run `Quarto: Create Project` - In the quickpick, type `Quarto: Create Project` and select this project ![](images/step6.png) ## Create Blog Project - You can choose the website or blog option. If you think you'll want to add a portfolio of your work, a blog is a great choice. - This doesn't lock you in forever. You can transition a blog into a website, or vice-versa later. ![](images/step7.png) ## Choose you GITHUB-USERNAME.github.io directory - Select the folder you made earlier, named `GITHUB-USERNAME.github.io` ![](images/step8.png) ## See your beautiful blog! - Explore these files. - `_quarto.yml` is the core configuration file of your website. - Anything ending in `*.qmd` is a _Quarto Markdown_ file. ![](images/step9.png) ## What is a Quarto markdown file? - Text - Code (either static or run on render) - Show [examples](https://quarto.org/docs/gallery/#websites) ```` ```python 1+1 ``` ```` ## Create repository for your blog Create a new repository with the name: `your-username.github.io` ![](images/step10.png) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
02:00
``` ::: ::: ## Copy command from GitHub ![](images/step11.png) ## Paste command in terminal - Make sure you are in the TERMINAL tab, not the CONSOLE tab ![](images/step12.png) ## Send your source code to GitHub - Queue up all your stages to be sent to GitHub ![](images/step13.png) ## Publish blog, part 1 - In the terminal, run `quarto publish gh-pages` ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
01:00
``` ::: ::: ## Publish blog, part 2 - Go to your GitHub repo -> `Settings` -> `Pages` - Choose `Deploy from branch` and set the branch to `gh-pages` ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
02:00
``` ::: ::: # SUCCESS (hopefully)
